scenarioDescription:
The HD 114762 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 114762 is a star with 0.8 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.2 times its radius. It is located 131.10 light years away from the solar system.

HD 114762 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 114762 system


HD 114762 b

HD 114762 b was discovered by the Oak Ridge Observatory observatory, in 1989-05, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.36 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 114762 b is 3399.420 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 114762 b is 12.440 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 114762 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 114762, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Oak Ridge Observatory.
name: HD 114762 - System With 1 Exoplanet
